newsitem.title: USA: At Home Network to offer Microsoft Network.
newsitem.headline: At Home Network to offer Microsoft Network.

text.p: At Home Corp, the high speeed internet access provider, on Wednseday said that Microsoft Corp's Microsoft Network will be available to subscibers of the At Home (@Home) Network.

The network will deliver multimedia content and interactive services via At Home's cable modem delivery system, which transmits data at speeds as much as 300 times faster than traditional dial-up modems, the company said.
Microsoft Network programming is scheduled to be available to At Home subscribers during the third quarter of 1997 for a flat fee of $6.95 per month.
At Home is a consortium of cable partners Tele-Communications Inc, Comcast Corp, Cox Communications Inc and venture capital firm Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers.
Last week, At Home filed for an initial public offering with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.
